message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY

This paper deals with topic-based methods for automating the detection of concept expressions in text, which is a common task in natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with the intersection of computer science and linguistics. Additionally, the paper uses machine learning techniques such as LDA (Latent Dirichlet Allocation) to perform the concept detection, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also evaluates its methods on a corpus of court decisions, which could place it in cs.IR (Information Retrieval) or cs.CY (Computers and Society).
